revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Electron-Neutrino Angular Correlations in Nuclear Decay
tldr: The authors describe an experiment that measures the electron-neutrino angular correlations in the decay of 23Na. They use a gaseous source of 23Ne and detect the electron and recoil momenta to determine the angle between the beta and neutrino rays. The results suggest that the decay is a combination of Gamow-Teller and scalar-type Fermi interactions, which may violate the isotopic spin selection rule.
